intro: Arophyton pedatum, commonly known as the footed bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant found in freshwater environments. It is characterized by its simple, branching stems and small, inflated leaves that serve as air bladders to aid in buoyancy. The plant is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family, which includes carnivorous plants. Arophyton pedatum lacks true roots and absorbs nutrients through its leaves. It is typically found in shallow, still waters where it can anchor itself to substrates.
